Pre-Game Insights: The Cleveland Guardians are 80-59 this year and have won three games in a row. They have won the first two games in this series by scores of 4-2 and 7-1. Prior to this series, the Guardians won two out of three against the Pirates, lost three out of four against the Royals, and won two out of three against the Rangers. Cleveland is 7-4 in their last 11 games and are first in the AL Central. The Guardians' pitching staff has a 3.80 ERA, a 1.21 WHIP, and a.232 opponent batting average. The offense has scored 635 runs with a.239 batting average and a.310 on-base percentage. Jose Ramirez is batting.273 with 34 home runs and 105 RBI's for the Guardians this season.

The Kansas City Royals are 75-65 this season and have lost seven games in a row. Kansas City has lost the first two games in this series and has allowed 11 runs in the two games. Prior to that series, the Royals lost all four against the Astros, won three out of four against the Guardians, and lost two out of three against the Phillies. Kansas City is 3-9 in their last 12 games and are third in the AL Central. The Royals' pitching staff has a 3.96 ERA, a 1.27 WHIP, and a.247 opponent batting average. The offense has scored 666 runs with a.253 batting average and a.310 on-base percentage. Bobby Witt is batting.340 with 30 home runs and 97 RBI's for the Royals this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the 100th meeting between the two teams.
